page.description: Returns .T. if the object is the last object on the form, as specified in the form's prompt order.
page.original:
&ltOBJECT>.IS_ON_LAST_OBJECT() Syntax Result_Flag as L = &ltOBJECT>.IS_ON_LAST_OBJECT() Description The &ltOBJECT>.IS_ON_LAST_OBJECT() method applies to:
Browses (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltBROWSE> pointer or the name of the browse)
Forms (for &ltOBJECT> use either the &ltFORM> pointer or the name of the form) The &ltOBJECT>.IS_ON_LAST_OBJECT() method returns .T. (TRUE) if the object is the last object on the layout, as specified in the layout's tab order; otherwise, it returns .F. (FALSE). Limitations Desktop applications only. Example dim frm as P frm = form.view("Customer Information") ? frm.Is_On_Last_Object() = .F.
See Also Form Functions and Methods, Browse Functions and Methods
